meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Elena Gray-Blanc Geoff Mitelman Philip Tiu Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7258.

td.p: Elena Gray-Blanc, an editor originally from Santa Barbara, California
Geoff Mitelman, a rabbi from Westchester County, New York
Philip Tiu, an educator from Atlanta, Georgia (whose 2-day cash winnings total $71,098)

tr.td: 19th CENTURY NOVELS BY QUOTE
BEHAVIOR & PSYCHOLOGY
I HAVE A PREPOSITION FOR YOU
THE NATIONAL ROAD
GET
A GRIP ON IT

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '"I shall fix some things she like not--garlic and a crucifix--and so seal up the door of the tomb"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: "I shall fix some things she like not--garlic and a crucifix--and so seal up the door of the tomb"

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_3_1', 'clue_J_3_1_stuck', '(Elena: What are up and down?)
(Alex: No.)
(Elena: What are--)
(Alex: No. You don\'t get two shots at it.)
(Elena: Sorry.)

across & down

GeoffElena
')

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_6_1', 'clue_DJ_6_1_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from Wright Brothers Nat\'l Memorial.) Seeking a place for test flights with strong winds, privacy & sand for soft landings, the Wrights wrote a letter to the U.S. weather bureau & received a list of possible locations; this small fishing village on North Carolina\'s Outer Banks was just perfect')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from Wright Brothers Nat'l Memorial.) Seeking a place for test flights with strong winds, privacy & sand for soft landings, the Wrights wrote a letter to the U.S. weather bureau & received a list of possible locations; this small fishing village on North Carolina's Outer Banks was just perfect

Frustrated with the data then available concerning wing & propeller designs, the Wrights built their own wind tunnel & tested dozens of models to see what shapes produced the most lift & the least of this force--the resistance to forward motion')

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_6_3', 'clue_DJ_6_3_stuck', '(Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from Wright Brothers Nat\'l Memorial in Kill Devil Hills, NC.) To provide more thrust, the Wrights used two propellers driven by a bicycle chain & sprocket; the laminated spruce propellers were carved by hand & mounted so they\'d rotate in opposite directions, canceling out this twisting force')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from Wright Brothers Nat'l Memorial in Kill Devil Hills, NC.) To provide more thrust, the Wrights used two propellers driven by a bicycle chain & sprocket; the laminated spruce propellers were carved by hand & mounted so they'd rotate in opposite directions, canceling out this twisting force

tr.td: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from Wright Brothers Nat'l Memorial in Kill Devil Hills, NC.) A device called an elevator was placed on the front of the Wrights' plane for more efficiency & to protect the pilot in case of a crash; operated by a lever, it adjusted this upward and downward motion of the plane's nose
